H0.text: who started the state of the union address. George Washington

H1.text: who started the state of the union address. Thomas Jefferson

H2.text: who started the state of the union address. James Madison

H3.text: who started the state of the union address. Woodrow Wilson

A4.text: George Washington delivered the first regular annual message before a joint session of Congress on January 8, 1790, in New York City, then the provisional U.S. capital.

A5.text: In 1801, Thomas Jefferson discontinued the practice of delivering the address in person, regarding it as too monarchical (similar to the Speech from the Throne).
